greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows where T(n,k) is the number of labeled simple graphs with n vertices that, if the isolated vertices are removed, have cut-connectivity k.
comment: We define the cut-connectivity of a graph to be the minimum number of vertices that must be removed (along with any incident edges) to obtain a disconnected or empty graph, with the exception that a graph with one vertex has cut-connectivity 1. Except for complete graphs, this is the same as vertex-connectivity.
xref: Row sums without the first column are A287689.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Sep 03 2019
